src:
Krško brez dirke za svetovno prvenstvo
04 Nov 2019, 10:30 by STA
Krško - Krovna zveza in vodstvo tekmovanja v spidveju sta včeraj objavila koledar dirk svetovnega prvenstva v spidveju za sezono 2020. Na seznamu tokrat ni dirke za VN Slovenije v Krškem, ki je doslej gostilo že 19 dirk na najvišji ravni. Novinec pa je ruski Toljati, kjer bo naslednje leto prva dirka za VN Rusije. Najboljši slovenski dirkač Matej Žagar, ki bo med elito dirkačev nastopal tudi v naslednji sezoni, tako ostaja brez domačega prizorišča.
Na koledarju za sezono 2020 je deset dirk. Uvod v novo sezono bo Varšavi 16. maja, pozneje se bodo dirkači preselili v nemški Tetrerow, Prago, ki je eno najbolj tradicionalnih prizorišč serije Grand Prix (naslednje leto bo tam že 24. zaporedna dirka za VN Češke), ter nato do konca julija še v Cardiff in švedski Hallstavik.
Druga polovica sezone se bo začela v poljskem Vroclavu, švedska Malilla bo gostila dirko za VN Skandinavije, ruska premiera bo na sporedu 29. avgusta, predzadnja postaja bo danski Vojens, sezona pa se bo končala na Poljskem v Torunu 3. oktobra.
Žagar si je vozovnico za SP 2020 zagotovil v letošnjih kvalifikacijah, kjer je zmagal in bil tako med tremi dirkači, ki so na ta način prišli med elitno petnajsterico. V seštevku SP 2019 je bil sicer na koncu deveti, kar ne bi bilo dovolj za nadaljevanje tudi v sezoni 2020, saj si neposredno uvrstitev zagotovi le najboljših osem.
V SP 2020 bodo nastopali svetovni prvak Poljak Bartosz Zmarzlik, Danec Leon Madsen, Rus Emil Sajfutdinov, Šved Fredrik Lindgren, Slovak Martin Vaculik, Poljaka Maciej Janowski in Patryk Dudek ter Avstralec Jason Doyle, ki so bili v najboljši osmerici letošnjega SP, ter Matej Žagar, Danec Niels-Kristian Iversen in Avstralec Max Fricke, ki so bili najboljši v kvalifikacijah. Posebna vabila krovne zveze in organizatorja tekmovanj pa so dobili nekdanja svetovna prvaka Britanec Tai Woffinden in Američan Greg Hancock, Rus Artjom Laguta in Šved Antonio Lindbaeck.
Vodstvo tekmovanja pa je za prihodnjo sezono uvedlo tudi nov sistem točkovanja. Ta zdaj ne bo več seštevek točk, doseženih v posameznih vožnjah, pač pa bo število dobljenih točk povezano s končno uvrstitvijo. Zmagovalec vsake dirke bo tako dobil 20 točk, drugi 18, tretji 16, četrti 14 ... vse do zadnjega, 16. ki bo dobil eno točko.

Spored SP v spidveju 2020:

16. maj: VN Poljske (Varšava)
30. maj: VN Nemčije (Teterow)
13. junij: VN Češke (Praga)
18. julij: VN Velike Britanije (Cardiff)
25. julij: VN Šveske (Hallstavik)
1. avgust: VN Poljske (Vroclav)
15. avgust: VN Skandinavije (Malilla, Švedska)
29. avgust: VN Rusije (Toljati)
12. september: VN Danske (Vojens)
3. oktober: VN Poljske (Torun)
Za naslov svetovnega prvaka se bodo potegovali: Bartosz Zmarzlik (Pol), Leon Madsen (Dan), Emil Sajfutdinov (Rus), Fredrik Lindgren (Šve), Martin Vaculik (Slk), Maciej Janowski (Pol), Jason Doyle (Avs), Patryk Dudek (Pol), Matej Žagar (Slo), Niels-Kristian Iversen (Dan), Artjom Laguta (Rus), Antonio Lindbaeck (Šve), Tai Woffinden (VBr), Max Fricke (Avs), Greg Hancock (ZDA)
text:
Krsko without a race for the World Cup
04 Nov 2019, 10:30 by STA
Krško - The umbrella association and the leadership of the speedway competition yesterday announced the calendar of World Cup races for the 2020 season. The list this time does not include the race for the GP of Slovenia in Krško, which has hosted 19 highest level races so far. The newcomer, however, is Russia's Tolyatti, which will be the first race for the Russian GP next year. The best Slovenian racer Matej Žagar, who will continue to compete among the elite of racers next season, remains without a home scene.
There are ten races on the calendar for the 2020 season. The introduction of the new season will take place in Warsaw on May 16, later the racers will move to the German Tetrerow, Prague, which is one of the most traditional venues of the Grand Prix series (there will be the 24th consecutive race for the Grand Prix of the Czech Republic next year), and then by the end of July still in Cardiff and Hallstadik Sweden.
The second half of the season will begin in Wroclaw in Poland, Sweden's Malilla will host the race for the Scandinavian GP, the Russian premiere will be scheduled on 29 August, the penultimate station will be the Danish Vojens, and the season will end in Poland in Torun on 3 October.
Žagar secured his ticket to the SP 2020 in this year's qualifiers, where he won and was among three racers who came in this way among the elite fifteen. In the SP 2019, he was ninth in the end, which would not be enough to continue in the 2020 season, as only the top eight would secure a direct ranking.
World Champion 2020 will feature Polish champion Bartosz Zmarzlik, Dan Leon Madsen, Rus Emil Sajfutdinov, Sweden Fredrik Lindgren, Slovak Martin Vaculik, Poles Maciej Janowski and Patryk Dudek, and Australia's Jason Doyle, who were in the top eight of this year's SP, and Matej Žagar , Niels-Kristian Iversen of Denmark and Max Fricke of Australia who were best in qualifying. Former World Champion Tai Woffinden and American Greg Hancock, Russian Artjom Laguta and Swede Antonio Lindbaeck received special invitations from the umbrella and the event organizer.
The competition management also introduced a new scoring system for the coming season. This will no longer be the sum of points scored in individual runs, but the number of points awarded will be linked to the final ranking. The winner of each race will thus receive 20 points, the second 18, the third 16, the fourth 14 ... until the last, the 16th, who will receive one point.

SP Schedule 2020:

May 16: GP of Poland (Warsaw)
May 30: GP of Germany (Teterow)
13 June: GP of the Czech Republic (Prague)
July 18: UK GP (Cardiff)
July 25: GP Sweden (Hallstavik)
1st of August: GP of Poland (Wroclaw)
15 August: Scandinavian GP (Malilla, Sweden)
August 29: Russian GP (Tolyatti)
September 12: GP Denmark (Vojens)
October 3: GP of Poland (Torun)
World Cup champions will be Bartosz Zmarzlik (Pol), Leon Madsen (Dan), Emil Sajfutdinov (Rus), Fredrik Lindgren (Swe), Martin Vaculik (Slk), Maciej Janowski (Pol), Jason Doyle (Avs). Patryk Dudek (Paul), Matthew Zagar (Slo), Niels-Kristian Iversen (Dan), Artjom Laguta (Rus), Antonio Lindbaeck (Swe), Tai Woffinden (VBr), Max Fricke (Avs), Greg Hancock (USA)
